maml:description.maml:para: Get next run for a given cron schedule.
Get next run for a given cron schedule.

maml:Description.maml:para: A datetime object including from which all operations will be relative to.
A datetime object including from which all operations will be relative to.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns 1:15 AM on the same day.

maml:description.maml:para: Parse a given cron schedule. Returns all execution times in the time range. The default range is the next 24 hours.
Return a UTC timestamp rounded to the nearest unit of time.
Return a UTC timestamp rounded to the nearest unit of time. Defaults to the nearest minute.

maml:Description.maml:para: The date to convert and round.
The unit of time to round to.
The date to convert and round.
The unit of time to round to.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the current UTC timestamp rounded to the nearest minute.

maml:description.maml:para: Runs a cron job based on the defined schedule.

maml:Description.maml:para: A ScriptBlock containing the job code to execute.
The name of the job. Used for logging.
Path to the log file. If no path is specified
Append to an existing job log.
A reference date to use when executing the job. By default uses the current time.
A file containing the job code to execute.
The name of the job. Used for logging.
Path to the log file. If no path is specified
Append to an existing job log.
A reference date to use when executing the job. By default uses the current time.
The name of the job. Used for logging.
A ScriptBlock containing the job code to execute.
A file containing the job code to execute.
Path to the log file. If no path is specified
Append to an existing job log.
A reference date to use when executing the job. By default uses the current time.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs a job called 'Test Job' that returns $true every minute.
Runs a job called 'Test Job' that returns $true every minute, then executes a function named '__SendEmail' with the job details.

maml:description.maml:para: Send a notification email from the output of Invoke-PSCronJob.

Send a notification email from the output of Invoke-PSCronJob. Uses Send-MailMessage under the hood. This function is an example for using pipeline output of Invoke-PSCronJob to perform additional steps.

maml:Description.maml:para: The notification subject. The subject will be parsed with the string formatter and {0} replaced with the job name.
Send the CronResult object down the pipeline.
The notification subject. The subject will be parsed with the string formatter and {0} replaced with the job name.
Send the CronResult object down the pipeline.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-PSCronJob '* * * * *' 'Test Job' { Write-Information 'Some Text' } -PassThru | Send-PSCronNotification -To 'recipient@domain.com' -From 'noreply@domain.com'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends a job notification to 'recipient@domain.com' for the job 'Test Job'. The email will include the Result as the message body.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks based on the schedule and reference date if a job should run.
Checks based on the schedule and reference date if a job should run.

maml:Description.maml:para: A reference date to use when testing if the schedule should run.
A reference date to use when testing if the schedule should run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns $true since this job runs every minute.
